definitions.definition: put a limit on; keep under control.
examples: some roads may have to be closed at peak times to restrict the number of visitors
synonyms: cut down "a busy working life restricted his leisure activities"

definitions.definition: deprive (someone or something) of freedom of movement or action.
examples: cities can restrict groups of protesters from gathering on a residential street
synonyms: shackle "the cuff supports the ankle without restricting movement"

definitions.definition: limit someone to only doing or having (a particular thing) or staying in (a particular place).
examples: I shall restrict myself to a single example
synonyms: limit "he restricted himself to a 15-minute speech"

definitions.definition: limit something, especially an activity, to (a particular place, time, or category of people).
examples: the zoological gardens were at first restricted to members and their guests

definitions.definition: withhold (information) from general circulation or disclosure.
examples: at first the government tried to restrict news of our involvement in Vietnam
